pageTitle: MySQL :: MySQL Cluster API Developer Guide :: 8.4 NDB Kernel Blocks
textBeforeTable: Table 8.1. NDB Kernel Blocks and Threads As described elsewhere, the NDB kernel makes use of a number of different threads to perform various tasks. Kernel blocks are associated with these threads as shown in the following table: This section provides information about the major software modules making up the NDB kernel. The files containing the implementations of these blocks can be found in several directories under storage/ndb/src/kernel/blocks/ in the MySQL Cluster source tree. 8.4.23. The TRIX Block 8.4.22. The TSMAN Block 8.4.21. The TRPMAN Block 8.4.20. The THRMAN Block 8.4.19. The SUMA Block 8.4.18. The RESTORE Block 8.4.17. The QMGR Block 8.4.16. The PGMAN Block 8.4.15. The NDBFS Block 8.4.14. The NDBCNTR Block 8.4.13. The LGMAN Block 8.4.12. The DBUTIL Block 8.4.11. The DBTUX Block 8.4.10. The DBTUP Block 8.4.9. The DBTC Block 8.4.8. The DBSPJ Block 8.4.7. The DBLQH Block 8.4.6. The DBINFO Block 8.4.5. The DBDIH Block 8.4.4. The DBDICT Block
textAfterTable: You can obtain more information about these threads from the documentation for the ThreadConfig data node configuration parameter.
